snippet: States like Delaware, which embraced gambling early, are allowing new types of gaming in a struggle to make up for the revenue lost to the casinos of their cash-hungry neighbors.
abstract: Many cash-hungry states are stepping up their efforts to lure gamblers from their neighbors to their growing ranks of slot machines, leaving states like Delaware, which embraced gambling early, struggling to keep up in what has become a feverish one-armed-bandit arms race.
lead_paragraph: States like Delaware, which embraced gambling early, are allowing new types of gaming in a struggle to make up for the revenue lost to the casinos of their cash-hungry neighbors.

headline.seo: Gambling Boom Leaves States Struggling to Catch Up
headline.main: States Up the Ante in Bid to Lure Other States’ Bettors
headline.print_headline: Casino Boom Has States Looking to the Internet For Gambling Dollars
